title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, star of The Cosby Show, dies aged 54
byline: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, who as teenage son Theo Huxtable on “The Cosby Show” was central to a cultural phenomenon that helped define the 1980s, died at 54 in an accidental drowning in Costa Rica, authorities there said Monday.

title: Fairly heavy rains above 75 mm likely in parts of the island
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (22), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: CEB workers to protest today against the Electricity Amendment Bill
byline: Electricity workers have decided to stage a protest today against the new Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill proposed by the government as part of the restructuring process of the electricity sector, including the CEB.

title: CC to consider recommendations for new Chief Justice
byline: The Constitutional Council is scheduled to convene tomorrow (23).

title: UK and 27 other nations condemn Israel over ‘inhumane killing’ of Gaza civilians seeking aid
byline: The UK and 27 other countries have called for an immediate end to the war in Gaza, where they say the suffering of civilians has “reached new depths”.

title: Indigo Flight with 140 passengers on board makes emergency landing at Indore Airport
byline: An IndiGo flight from Goa with 140 passengers on board made an emergency landing at the Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport in Indore on Monday evening following a technical alert related to its landing gear, officials said.

title: Prince Harry and Prince William’s cousin, 20, found dead with a ‘firearm nearby’
byline: Rosie Roche, the 20-year-old second cousin of Prince William and Prince Harry, has been found dead at her family property, with a firearm discovered close by, an inquest has heard.

title: BOI approves 57 projects, Sri Lanka gets USD 569mn in FDIs in 2025: Dy Minister
byline: The Board of Investment (BOI) has approved 57 projects while Sri Lanka has received USD 569 million in Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) so far this year (2025), according to Deputy Minister Chaturanga Abeysingha.

title: Tuk-Tuk robbers nabbed in Polgasowita
byline: Three individuals allegedly involved in a series of three-wheeler robberies have been apprehended by the Mount Lavinia Crimes Investigation Division, police stated.

title: Committee of Inquiry finds IGP Deshabandhu Tennakoon guilty of all allegations, recommends his removal
byline: The Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on suspended Inspector General of Police Deshabandhu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power has found him guilty of all allegations leveled against the IGP.

title: Earth will spin faster today to create 2nd-shortest day in history
byline: Earth will complete a full rotation in slightly less time than usual on Tuesday, July 22, making it one of the shortest days ever recorded.

title: Gita Gopinath, No.2 in IMF to quit in August; Successor to be named soon
byline: Gita Gopinath, the second-in-command at the International Monetary Fund (IMF), will step down at the end of August to return to her position at Harvard University, the IMF has announced.

title: Increase in female population over males could lead to future crises, expert warns
byline: The continuous decline in the male population in comparison to the number of females in Sri Lanka could lead to significant crises in the future, Senior Professor Aminda Methsila of Wayamba University of Sri Lanka has warned.

title: Ex-LTTE member arrested with T-56 firearm in Peliyagoda
byline: A 30-year-old individual has been arrested in Peliyagoda by the Kiribathgoda Police last evening (21), based on a tip-off.

title: Canadian woman arrested at BIA with 18kg of hashish
byline: A 37-year-old Canadian woman has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for the possession of a large consignment of hashish.

title: Trump administration releases FBI records on MLK Jr. despite his family’s opposition
byline: The Trump administration on Monday released records of the FBI’s surveillance of Martin Luther King Jr., despite opposition from the slain Nobel laureate’s family and the civil rights group that he led until his 1968 assassination.

title: SL receives USD 63 bln in remittances over past decade – Deputy Minister
byline: The total amount of remittances received by Sri Lanka through foreign employment over the past 10 years is USD 61,147 million, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Arun Hemachandra has stated.

title: Cabinet gives green light to gazette draft bill to amend Presidents Entitlements Act
byline: The Cabinet of Minister has granted approval to the proposal to gazette and present in Parliament the draft bill formulated to amend the Presidents Entitlements Act (No. 4 of 1986) and reduce special privileges extended to former Presidents, their families, and retired Members of Parliament.

title: Cabinet Spokesman confirms President’s nomination for next CJ
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has nominated Supreme Court Justice Preethi Padman Surasena as the next Chief Justice of Sri Lanka, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has confirmed.

title: “No need to arrest ex-CID Director Rohan Premaratne at this juncture”: Bribery Commission informs Court
byline: Court was informed today (22) that there is no necessity at this time to arrest former CID Director retired DIG Rohan Premaratne, by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), in connection with on-going investigation.

title: Dy Commissioner of Inland Revenue Dept arrested for soliciting bribe granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to the Deputy Commissioner of the Inland Revenue Department, who was previously arrested and remanded on suspicion of soliciting a bribe of Rs. 100,000 from a businessman in order to waive around Rs. 1.1 million in tax arrears owed to the department.

title: ‘Red’ warning for strong winds up to 70 kmph issued
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas in the areas extending from Kalpitiya to Kankesanthurai via Mannar and from Hambantota to Pottuvil.

title: Sri Lanka should grant zero-tariff access to US exports: Ravi tells Govt
byline: The government of Sri Lanka should grant zero-tariff access to products from the United States immediately, according to New Democratic Front (NDF) Member of Parliament Ravi Karunanayake.

title: Over 1,400 arrested for various offenses including drugs in special operation
byline: Sri Lanka Police, Police Special Task Force (STF), and tri-forces personnel jointly conducted several more search operations throughout the day on Tuesday (July 21) as part of ongoing efforts to arrest individuals involved in drug-related activities and other major crimes.

title: Govt responds to concerns over ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s security
byline: The government is responsible not only for the safety of former presidents but also for the general public, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has emphasized in response to questions raised in relation to the move by the present administration to remove the entitlements of former Presidents and their family members.

title: Adjournment debate on proposed education reforms to be held on Thursday
byline: An adjournment debate on the proposed education reforms is scheduled to be held in Parliament on Thursday (24).

title: Manusha’s former personal secretary granted bail
byline: The Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawala has ordered the release on bail of Shan Yahampath Gunaratne, the former personal secretary to former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Cabinet nod to establish Threat Hunting and Malware Analysis Lab
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the establishment of a Cyber Threat and Malware Analysis Research Unit within the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (Sri Lanka CERT).

title: Fire breaks out in a building in Nittambuwa
byline: A fire has broken out in a building in the Nittambuwa town.

title: Sri Lanka to initiate joint research with Singapore to develop AI technologies
byline: The government is seeking to commence joint research with Singapore for the development of artificial intelligence technologies, conduct artificial intelligence programs, and create mutual cooperation to address local and global challenges.

title: World Health Organization condemns Israeli attacks on facilities in Gaza
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) says Israel’s ground offensive in central Gaza has compromised its efforts to continue working, after its facilities came under attack.

title: Three elephants including tusker found dead in Digampathaha
byline: The carcasses of three wild elephants including a tusker—whose tusks had been removed and is believed to have died about a month ago—were discovered within the Digampathaha area of the Inamaluwa Forest Reserve, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Shan Yahampath arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Shan Yahampath, the former personal secretary of former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Sri Lankans to be sent to Korea under E–8 Visa program
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement a pilot project to send Sri Lankans under the E–8 Visa category (seasonal employees) for employment in the Republic of Korea and to conduct discussions with local government institutions in South Korea to seek employment opportunities.
